author: TheBricker
title: One of the best HP sets.
review:
I recently got this set and built it, and let me tell you, it's a great set for display AND play. The exterior is gorgeous and blows the 2010 version out of the water! The upper floors might look unstable, but trust me, the Lego designers have done a great job here! The set is very stable and the play features work perfectly.

I'm a Harry Potter fanboy myself, and there's a ton of references and details for all HP fans to spot! In fact, there's some book related details which didn't appear in the movies! The minifigures are awesome as well! I was especially excited to get my first Bellatrix, who doesn't appear in a lot of sets, but the rest of them are just as good!

While I do think that 120 Eur is a bit overpriced for this set, I can't really complain about it, as the pricing is far from terrible. It is a set with over 1000 pieces after all. 

In the end, this is definitely one of the best sets within the theme. I think it's safe to say that this set is in my top 3 along with Hogwarts Castle from 2010 and 4 Privet Drive of this year. Amazing set, would totally recommend this one.

author: lego_sloth
title: This. Is. BEAUTIFUL!
review: This set is stunning. I will start with the minifigures. First off, I am so pleased to finally have a Tonks minifigure. I do wish that her hair was pink though. The rest of the minifigures are amazing too. The Weasleys are perfectly rumpled, and Harry is quite accurate this year, as I feel as though he has not been very accurate in the previous waves. Now, on to the building. It is stunning! It is packed with details, such as Molly's clock, the green fire in the fireplace, the knitting supplies, and the picture of the Weasleys in Egypt! I also love Ron and Ginny's Quidditch themed blankets! My only complaint is that Ron's bedroom is a bit too cramped for me to get in there and play. That is the only flaw though! I also love the new Hedwig mold, and the pink pig is SO CUTE! I do wish that the owl was grey, because I do believe that Errol was grey. It could be Pidwigeon though. Anyway, if you can find it, snatch this set up now, it was difficult for me to find.

author: claMaga
title: Ricco di dettagli, divertente
review:
Set fantastico, ricco di dettagli e molto preciso. Ho confrontato il set con la casa presente nel film e sono molto simili.

Esperienza di costruzione molto divertente, sia per la grande quantità di oggetti mobili sia per la quantità di pezzi e dettagli.

L'ho trovata tuttavia un po' piena, con poco spazio di gioco all'interno, ma credo che sia in linea con la Tana, che non è una casa molto grande e spaziosa.

Consigliato
